info.name: TransactionTree
info.description: This collection contains TransactionTree's RESTful APIs for digital receipt delivery, loyalty integration, coupon and promotion services, customer engagement, and retail data synchronization. It includes endpoints for the Virtual Receipt Gateway (VRG), Branded Retail Marketing Cloud (BORMC), and MessageManager (MM). Use this collection to test and integrate receipt issuance, customer lookup, loyalty programs, SMS messaging, and transactional data feeds across in-store and eCommerce environments.

item.name: Overview
API Credentials & Security
item.description:
ACCOUNT CREDENTIALS

This document will cover the different credentials for interacting with TransactionTree's APIs, and how to authenticate with each API.

BASIC AUTHORIZATION

All of TransactionTree's APIs are protected with basic authorization over HTTPS. Basic Authorization requires the credential pair to be encoded with base64 as part of the Authorization HTTP header.

Credentials Defined

Credential Name Description Usage
username The username for your VRG API credentials VRG
password The password for your VRG API credentials VRG
sectoken Security token generated by the VRG and expires after 15 minutes. VRG
X-tenant-Key Unique identifier that represents a single merchant in BORMC. BORMC
accessTokenKey Base 64 encoded key that is generated by BORMC. BORMC
client_id The client id for your MessageManager API credentials MM
client_password The client password for your MessageManager API credentials MM
access_token Access token generated by the MessageManager API MM

API CREDENTIALS

All TransactionTree API access must be requested and approved. Please submit your request to support@transctiontree.com.

Welcome to TransactionTree's Developer Docs

TransactionTree offers RESTful Web Services to allow the transfer of data to and from our infrastructure.
This is proved through three different services.
Virtual Receipt Gateway (VRG)

Digital receipts, content, triggered emails, and customer lookup.		 BranchedOut Retail Marketing Cloud (BORMC)

Loyalty, Coupons, and Promotions		 MessageManager (MM)

Text Messages, two way communication, and remote payments.

item.name: Response Codes
item.description:
Type Code Reason Description
Error 400 Bad Request Bad syntax in the client request
Error 401 Unauthorized This is used when the resource is restricted to certain authenticated users.
Error 403 Forbidden User made a valid request but the server is refusing to serve the request, due to a lack of permission to access the requested resource
Error 404 Not Found User is able to communicate with the server but it is unable to locate the requested file or resource
Error 405 Method Not Allowed This is used when the request is well-formed and the resource it asks for does exist, but the request method (such as GET or POST) is not appropriate to the resource.
Error 410 Gone Status code is used if the server knows, through some internally configurable mechanism, that an old resource is permanently unavailable and has no forwarding address
Error 500 Internal Server Error The server cannot process the request for an unknown reason
Error 501 Not Implemented This is returned when the HTTP request method (such as PUT or DELETE), the API method in some cases, has not yet been implemented.
Error 502 Bad Gateway Means that the server is not receiving a valid response from the backend servers that should actually fulfill the request
Error 503 Service Unavailable Means that the server is overloaded or under maintenance
Error 504 Timeout Means that the server is not receiving a response from the backend servers within the allowed time period.
Error 505 HTTP Version Not Supported The HTTP protocol version used in the request.
Error 701 Invalid username or password The username or password provide is invalid.
Error 702 Invalid Security Token The security token provided is not valid.
Error 703 Security Token Expired The security token provided has expired.
Error 705 General Error This is a general error.
Error 708 Missing File File was not attached in the message.
Valid 800 Upload Success The upload has been excepted by the VRG.
Valid 800 Logout Success Logout was success.
Valid 800 Email Address The email address that the VRG has on file.
Valid 801 Email address with preference The email on file has a receipt preference saved.
Valid 802 NoEmail No email is on file for the id provided.
Valid 803 Email but no Receipt preference An email is on file for the id provided but no receipt preference has been saved
Valid 804 Bounced The email on file for this id has bounced prior
Valid 805 Email Blocklist The email on file has been added to the blocklist and is no allowed. Ask user to contact a service rep.
Valid 806 Format Emails that fail RFC syntax protocols
Valid 807 Spamtrap These emails are believed to be spamtraps and should not be mailed. We have technology in place to determine if certain emails should be classified as spamtrap. We don't know all the spamtrap email addresses, but we do know a lot of them.
Valid 808 Abuse These emails are of people who are known to click the abuse or spam links in emails, hence abusers or complainers. We recommend not emailing these addresses. If you wish to email display a message targeted at these email addresses.
Valid 809 Forbidden An id has been provided that is not allowed to be emailed to.
Valid 810 Multiple Emails Multiple Email addresses found for ID
Valid 811 No MX Record The domain that an email is going to can not receive emails.
Valid 812 Domain Corrected The email domain has been automatically corrected. Please have customer check email address again.
Valid 814 Valid Email Format The email address has passed all format and block list checks.
Valid 815 Domain Blocked This domain is blocked by TransactionTree and no emails will be sent.
Valid 817 Phone Prefix Blocked The prefix of the phone number is not allowed.
Valid 818 Phone Area Code Blocked The area code of the phone number is not allowed.

item.name: Content
item.description: Content lookup is used to get content that is stored in the system.

TransactionTree's Virtual Receipt Gateways (VRG) are used by merchants and technology providers to ingest customer data and distribute digital receipts.

All of TransactionTree's digital receipt technology is protected by US patent 8643875.

item.name: BranchedOut Retail Marketing Cloud
Customer

request.description:
The find customer service is used to find a customer. This service should always be used prior to updating or creating a customer in order to obtain the CUSTOMER_ID. Customers can be found using the following:
  • Phone Number Only
  • Email Only
  • Partial Email
  • Phone Number and Email
  • Customer Name

Request Schema

https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Customer/getPersonCompleteDetailsRequestB.xsd

request.description:
The coupon authentication service enables a client application to validate a coupon number with BORMC. The coupn number is generated based on LUHN Formula and is always unique.
There are five coupon status codes that may be returned.
  1. COUPON_AVAILABLE: The coupon is valid and available to use.
  2. COUPON_UNAVAILABLE: The coupon code is wrong or not valid.
  3. COUPON_EXPIRED: This coupon has expired.
  4. COUPON_REDEEMED: The coupon has already been redeemed.
  5. COUPON_AUDITED: The coupon has already been redeemed and there is a matching order in the system.

Request Schema
https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Coupon/CouponAuthenticationRequest.xsd Response Schema
https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Coupon/CouponAuthenticationResponse.xsd
Codes Description Status Code
E101 Empty Input String Passed  
E102 XML SAX Exception  
E103 XML Parse Conf Exception  
E104 XML IOException  
E113 Coupon for the store does not exist  
E114 Coupon does not exists COUPON_UNAVAILABLE
E116 Coupon Code is Null  
E121 No Transaction found for this customer  
E123 Coupon Expired COUPON_EXPIRED
E127 Store does not exists  
E841 Coupon does not exists in the system  
E842 Requested coupon type is wrong  
E899 Access key is wrong  
E999 Run time exception  

Note: There is no success code.

response.name: E110 Customer ID Cannot be Empty

request.description:
This service will provide a list of coupons and there status for a single customer. The customer id should be found prior to requesting this service. Request Schema
https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Coupon/CustomerCertificateSearchRequest.xsd Response Schema
https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Coupon/CustomerCertificateSearchResponse.xsd

Response Codes
Codes Description Status Code
E101 Empty Input String Passed  
E102 XML SAX Exception  
E103 XML Parse Conf Exception  
E104 XML IOException  
E110 Customer Id Cannot be Empty  
E111 Cannot Find Customer  
E120 Loyalty Id not assigned for this customer  
E121 No Transaction found for this customer  
S101 Completed Succesfully

response.name: E113:  Coupon for the store does not exist

item.name: Orders

request.description:
Any system invoking this method will get the order header information of a given customer or cross referred customer. All order headers that are with in the requested range will be in the response. Data elements that may be included in the response are:
  • ORDER_ID
  • FIRST_NAME
  • LAST_NAME
  • ORDER_DATE
  • EMAIL_ID
  • TAX
  • SHIPMENT_METHOD
  • PROMOTION_ADJUSTMENT
  • SUB_TOTAL
  • TOTAL_AMOUNT
  • STORE_ID
  • CASH_REGISTER_ID
  • TRANSACTION_NUMBER
  • TRANSACTION_TYPE
  • ASSOCIATE_ID
  • ASSOCIATE_FIRST_NAME
  • ASSOCIATE_LAST_NAME
  • TOTAL_TAX_AMOUNT
  • CUSTOMER_CROSS_REFERENCES
  • PRIMARY_PHONE
  • PRIMARY_FAX

By default 6 months of data is retrieved, if from and thru date is null. getOrderHeaderDetailsRequestB Schema: https://www.transactiontree.com/framework/schema/bormc/Orders/getOrderHeaderDetailsRequestB.xsd

request.description:
When getOrderHeaderDetailsC service invoked, the details for multiple orders is passed to the requesting application. **Required Elements:**

  • ORDER_ID

  • REQUEST_DATE

  • STORE_ID

**Recommended Elements to Increase Speed of the Request:**

  • CUSTOMER_ID

  • ORDER_STATUS

item.description:
Transactions can be retrieved in two ways.
  1. OrderHeaderInfo: This service only fetches the order header information.
  2. OrderCompleteDetails: This service fetches the order header and order item information.

item.description:
The products end point can be used to update all content associated with a product.
XML Element Name Description Datatype
PRODUCTID* PRODUCT IDENTIFIER (ALPHANUMERIC) VARCHAR(20)
PRODUCTNAME* Product Name for Title Display VARCHAR(20)
DESCRIPTION1 Product Description of the Product (english) VARCHAR(255)
DESCRIPTION2 Additional Descriptions of the Product (diff Locale) or Content type VARCHAR(255)
DESCRIPTION3 Additional Descriptions of the Product (diff Locale) or Content type VARCHAR(255)
DESCRIPTION4 Additional Descriptions of the Product (diff Locale) or Content type VARCHAR(255)
DESCRIPTION5 Additional Descriptions of the Product (diff Locale) or Content type VARCHAR(255)
L2DESCRIPTION1 Long Description of the Product (english) LONGTEXT
L2DESCRIPTION2 Addl Long Description of the Product based on the Content Type in ERP or Different Locale LONGTEXT
L2DESCRIPTION3 Addl Long Description of the Product based on the Content Type in ERP or Different Locale LONGTEXT
L2DESCRIPTION4 Addl Long Description of the Product based on the Content Type in ERP or Different Locale LONGTEXT
L2DESCRIPTION5 Addl Long Description of the Product based on the Content Type in ERP or Different Locale LONGTEXT
PRODUCTTYPE* Product type - Allowed (FINISHED_GOOD / SERVICE /DIGITAL_GOOD / RAW_MATERIAL ) VARCHAR(20)
DEFAULTSHIPMENT Default Shipment Box Type (YOUR_PACKAGING) - See List of other Options in Appendix VARCHAR(20)
SMALLIMAGEURL Absolute or Relative URL path of the Images (if any folder and same name of the Image with different resolution) VARCHAR(20)
MEDIUMIMAGEURL Absolute or Relative URL path of the Images (if any folder and same name of the Image with different resolution) VARCHAR(20)
LARGEIMAGEURL Absolute or Relative URL path of the Images (if any folder and same name of the Image with different resolution) VARCHAR(20)
DETAILIMAGEURL Absolute or Relative URL path of the Images (if any folder and same name of the Image with different resolution) VARCHAR(20)
REQUIREINVENTORY Product Stock - Requirement mandatory or non-mandatory (Y/N) CHAR(1)
RETURNABLE Is Product Returnable (Y/N) CHAR(1)
TAXABLE Is Product Taxable (Y/N) CHAR(1)
CHARGESHIPPING Is Shipping Chargeable for the Product (Y/N) CHAR(1)
WEIGHT Weight of the Product based on Unit of Measure (UOM) decimal(18,6)
HEIGHT Height of the Product based on Unit of Measure (UOM) decimal(18,6)
LENGTH Length of the Product based on Unit of Measure (UOM) decimal(18,6)
WIDTH Width of the Product based on Unit of Measure (UOM) decimal(18,6)
UNITQTY Quanity in inventory INTEGER
QTYUOMID Should be one of the UOM value for each dimension of the Product (Liquid -VLIQ_L (litres) / VLIQ_bbl (Barrel)) if null then Unit Qty is Considered VARCHAR(20)
WGHUOMID UOM ID of the Weight - WT_lb / WT_kg VARCHAR(20)
HEIGHTUOMID LEN_cm / LEN_mm / LEN_m - Any one of the UOM should be passed VARCHAR(20)
LENGTHUOMID LEN_cm / LEN_mm / LEN_m - Any one of the UOM should be passed VARCHAR(20)
WIDTHUOMID LEN_cm / LEN_mm / LEN_m - Any one of the UOM should be passed VARCHAR(20)
DROPSHIP Is Product is DropShip (Y/N) CHAR(1)
PRODUCTCATEGORYID1 Product Category Hierarchy Level 1 - ID VARCHAR(20)
PRODUCTCATEGORYID2 Product Category Hierarchy Level 2 - ID VARCHAR(20)
PRODUCTCATEGORYID3 Product Category Hierarchy Level 3 - ID VARCHAR(20)
PRODUCTCATEGORYID4 Product Category Hierarchy Level 4 - ID VARCHAR(20)
PRODUCTCATEGORYID5 Product Category Hierarchy Level 5 - ID VARCHAR(20)
FEATURETYPEDESC1 Product Feature Description Eg: COLOR , SIZE VARCHAR(100)
FEATUREDESC1 Product Feature Value (RED,BLUE or XXL Sizes) - must be name of the Value VARCHAR(100)
FEATURETYPEDESC2 Product Feature Description Eg: COLOR , SIZE VARCHAR(100)
FEATUREDESC2 Product Feature Value (RED,BLUE or XXL Sizes) - must be name of the Value VARCHAR(100)
FEATURETYPEDESC3 Product Feature Description Eg: COLOR , SIZE VARCHAR(100)
FEATUREDESC3 Product Feature Value (RED,BLUE or XXL Sizes) - must be name of the Value VARCHAR(100)
PRODUCTBRAND Product Brand Name VARCHAR(100)
FILTERDESC1 Product Filters if Any Applicable VARCHAR(100)
FILTERDESC2 Product Filters if Any Applicable VARCHAR(100)
FILTERDESC3 Product Filters if Any Applicable VARCHAR(100)
FILTERDESC4 Product Filters if Any Applicable VARCHAR(100)
FILTERDESC5 Product Filters if Any Applicable VARCHAR(100)
UPCA UPC 12 Digit Code of the Product VARCHAR(20)
ID1 Alternate ID or Merchant ID of the Product VARCHAR(20)
ID2 Alternate ID or Merchant ID of the Product VARCHAR(20)
FROMDATE Product Activation Date datetime
THRUDATE Product Expiry or Discontinuation Date datetime
ATTRIBUTE1 Product Feature Information or Additional Data Descriptors VARCHAR(20)
ATTRIBUTE2 Product Feature Information or Additional Data Descriptors VARCHAR(20)
ATTRIBUTE3 Product Feature Information or Additional Data Descriptors VARCHAR(20)
ATTRIBUTE4 Product Feature Information or Additional Data Descriptors VARCHAR(20)
ATTRIBUTE5 Product Feature Information or Additional Data Descriptors VARCHAR(20)
DEFAULTPRICE Default Price of the Product decimal(18,4)
LISTPRICE List Price of the Product decimal(18,4)

* = REQUIRED

item.description: This service is used to authenticate and redeem digital gift cards issued by TransactionTree. Gift cards can be redeemed in whole or part and additional value can be added.

This document describes the BranchedOut Retail Marketing Cloud (BORMC) web services and how-to setup machine-to-machine communication with BORMC.

Sandbox

https://sb.bormc.com

Required Credentials

HTTP header Description
X-tenant-Key Key that identifies a merchant
accessTokenKey base64 encoded key

item.name: MessageManager

request.description: Used to get the token

item.name: Messages

request.description:
Used to send a single text message to one phone number.

| **Element** | **Description** | **Required** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| TTMMVersion | The version of the TransactionTree schema being used. | Y |
| MessageType | Create or Update | Y |
| DateTime | Current Date and Time YYYY-MM-DD HH.MM.SS | Y |
| MessageID | YYYYMMDD:MerchantID:SiteID:TerminalID:TransactionID:HHMMSS | Y |
| MerchantNumber | Unique Id provided by TransactionTree | Y |
| StoreNumber | This store id that the request is from | Y |
| ApplicationID | The application sending the request | Y |
| **Associate** |  |  |
| IdType | OperatorID, EmployeeID, SalespersonID, or UserID | Y |
| Id | Value of the associated IdType | Y |
| **To** |  |  |
| MessageDeliveryMethod | sms or mms | Y |
| **Person** |  |  |
| PersonType | Recipient, Billing, Shipping, or Pickup | Y |
| **Phone** |  |  |
| PhoneType | primary or mobile | Y |
| PhoneNumber | full phone number with country code | Y |
| **Content** |  |  |
| Type | UpdateEmail, Signup, General, Destroy | Y |
| Text | Text to be sent | N |
Used to send a single text message to one phone number.
Used to send a single text message to one phone number.
Used to send a single text message to multiple phone numbers
Returns individual message record(s) by the given message ID(s). The length of inbound messages is unlimited. Batch request is supported.
Returns all messages to and from a merchants phone number.
Returns all messages to and from a single phone number.
Synchronizes messages.
Delete all messages related to a single phone number

item.description: This service is used to send and receive text messages.
TransactionTree's MessageManager is used to send and receive messages and dynamically generate data driven web pages.
